blocks.content: 1.3 Why Version Control, Hosting, and Security Matter

Web development is not only about coding; it also involves teamwork, deployment, and security. These three aspects ensure that projects can be developed smoothly, launched, and maintained over the long term.

items: **Definition**: Tools that track code history, making collaboration and rollback easier.
**Benefits**: Enables multiple people to develop simultaneously, quickly locate problematic versions, prevents code loss.
**Key learning points**: Git Commit Convention, Branch Workflow.

blocks.title: Analogy
blocks.content: Version control is like a 'time machine'‚Äîyou can always go back to a previous version to avoid a complete breakdown.

items: **Definition**: Deploying a website to a server so that internet users can access it.
**Benefits**: Globally accessible, supports automatic deployment, improves performance and scalability.
**Key learning points**: Deployment process, domain setup, HTTPS.

blocks.title: Analogy
blocks.content: Hosting is like 'renting a shop space.' Without hosting, even if you have a complete website, users cannot visit.

items: **Definition**: Protecting the website and user data from malicious attacks.
**Benefits**: Increases user trust, prevents data leaks, ensures service stability.
**Key learning points**: Input validation, access control, HTTPS encryption.

blocks.title: Analogy
blocks.content: Security is like a 'security system.' Without it, your website could be invaded at any time.

blocks.title: Summary
blocks.content: To have a complete and professional website: **Version Control** keeps development organized, **Hosting** brings the site online, and **Security** ensures long-term stability. All three are indispensable.
